>=
 image processing media type / link-reltypes, if he is free to invent its

 own?

Regarding the media-type: REST states that media-types should be reg=
istered with a central authority (IANA, Enterprise, what ever). When regist=
ering new media-types the authority checks for duplicates - or sets up a pr=
ocedure for avoiding them. This is REST's way of reducing the problem (I do=
n't believe it goes away completely - but the problem becomes smaller).

So=
me link-reltypes are document together with the media type (as Mike points =
out, link-reltypes can exist outside any media-type - see http://www.iana.o=
rg/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xml).

So when the client orig=
inally sent the Accept-header with application/vnd.imageprocessor+xml) it t=
old the server to return a representation that contains link-reltypes docum=
ented in the media-type spec. Other link-reltypes are of course allowed, bu=
t may be ignored by the client.

So, again, the media-type becomes the turn=
ing point.
